required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optical Coherence Tomography of Nerve Fiber Layer and Ganglion Cell Complex After Cataract Extraction
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Between OCT Nerve Fiber Layer and Ganglion Cell Complex Parameters Following Cataract Extraction in Patients With or Without Primary Open Angle Glaucoma

brief_summary.textblock: Optical coherence tomography (OCT) for retinal nerve fiber layer (RNFL) and ganglion cell complex (GCC) is done before and after cataract extraction in patients with or without primary open angle glaucoma (POAG)

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigator's study includes two groups of patients, each consists of 25 eyes, group 1 (cataract group)includes patients who are planned for cataract extraction without any other preexisting retinal or optic nerve pathology that may affect the RNFL thickness, while group 2 (combined cataract and glaucoma group) includes patients who are diagnosed with POAG controlled on medical treatment with cataract and planned for cataract extraction only.
The OCT scans with complete ophthalmological examination are done before surgery and 6 weeks after uneventful cataract extraction (phacoemulsification with intraocular lens implantation)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Oct scans before and 6 weeks after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of RNFL and GCC thickness change after cataract extraction

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the final BCVA recorded according to the Snellen chart and converted to logMAR for statistical analysis

other_outcome.measure: Intraocular pressure (IOP) change and central foveal thickness (CFT) change
other_outcome.description: Assessment of the IOP and CFT change after cataract extraction

arm_group.description: Group 1 includes patients who are planned for cataract extraction without any other preexisting retinal or optic nerve pathology that may affect the RNFL thickness. OCT (investigation) before and after cataract extraction
Group 2 includes patients who are diagnosed with POAG controlled on medical treatment and have cataract and planned for cataract extraction only OCT is done before and after cataract extraction

intervention.description: Oct scans to assess thickness of RNFL and GCC before and after cataract extraction surgery in both groups

study_pop.textblock: Patients with cataract without any other concomitant retinal, optic nerve head pathology other than POAG are included in the study and divided into two groups Group 1 patients with cataract only Group 2 patients with cataract and POAG who are planned for cataract surgery only and controlled on medical treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
â€¢ patients with cataract without any other concomitant retinal, optic nerve head pathology other than POAG are included in the study and divided onto two groups
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients having any retinal or optic nerve pathology that might have affected nerve fiber layer thickness other than POAG eg: high myopia
- POAG patients who are planned for combined surgery
- Refractive errors greater than spherical equivalent of 6 diopters (myopia or hypermetropia)
- Dense cataract hindering OCT imaging
- History of previous ocular surgery or trauma
